name: Infinity Girl
description:
Speed. Rhythm. Flow.

Infinity Girl is a high-speed rhythm/roguelike where everything — every action, every enemy and every world you encounter — is driven by the beat of the music. Each run is unique, with procedural levels that test your skills as you grind, drift, boost and leap to the rhythm. Get into a flow and blast through levels at incredible speeds, gaining game-changing abilities along the way.

Note: this is a pre-alpha demo! You'll have a good time (but expect a few bugs). Lots of polish, optimizations, sound effects, new enemies/obstacles, abilities, levels and so much more are in the works. I'm releasing this to get early feedback from the community as I work towards a proper alpha version. This demo has five levels, all procedurally generated so each run is unique. The final game will have around 16 levels in each run across multiple different worlds, with a roguelite permanent progression system, procedural music and a mind-bending story that reveals itself over many runs.

Demo instructions: Please read before you play!
  • A controller is required (for now) 
  • First time playing? Do the tutorial first! 
  • Press start to see the controls and instructions.
  • You have to boost, brake, bank (L & R) and jump on beat -- the dots at the bottom of your screen can help you visualize the rhythm.
  • Once you have a trail behind you, you're in a streak. Once you're in a streak, try to hold and release B on beat to use your brake blast! During a streak, you can also use special abilities (mega boost and the kangaroo jump) which you can upgrade between levels as you.
  • Select will reset your position to the last checkpoint. The final "boss" level has no checkpoints ;-)
  • As you collect coins over multiple runs, you'll eventually earn more permanent starting lives!

Like the demo? Wishlist the game on Steam here! Let us know what you think! Join our Discord to get access to future betas and help shape the game.

Your feedback in this early stage will really help shape the game as it evolves. Thanks!
